Reference

tern-package

TLG creation functions

Compound Tables

These tables are often compound tables that are found in the GDSR templates. Note that they all have the table_tree argument to return the collection of elementary tables.

t_summary()

Summary

t_summary(<data.frame>)

Variables Summary Table

t_summary_by()

Summarize an Object for Different Groups with by Variable

t_forest_rsp()

Response Table as used for Forest Plot

t_forest_tte()

Time-to-event Table as used for Forest Plot

t_rsp()

Response Table

t_tte()

Time to Event Table

t_events_patyear()

event rate adjusted per person-years at Risk

t_events_per_term_grade_id()

Events by Highest Grade Table

t_events_per_term_id()

Basic Events Table

t_mmrm()

(Deprecated) Mix model with repeated measurements (MMRM) model

t_mmrm_cov()

Tabulation

t_mmrm_diagnostic()

Tabulation

t_mmrm_fixed()

Tabulation

t_mmrm_lsmeans()

Tabulate the LS means of an MMRM model.

t_count_true()

Counts

t_count_true(<data.frame>)

Counts

t_count_unique()

Count unique elements per cell in a vector with subgroups

t_logistic()

Multi-variable logistic regression table

t_abnormality()

Abnormality Table

t_binary_outcome()

Summary table for binary outcome

t_coxreg()

Cox proportional hazards regression for standard outputs

t_cox_univariate()

Cox regression including a single covariate - tabulated results

t_cox_multivariate()

Multivariate Cox Model - tabulated results

t_ancova()

Summary table for analysis of covariance (ANCOVA).

Elementary Tables

These are tables that are often used in compound tables or graphs.

t_summary(<default>)

Return an rtable with a no Method Message

t_summary(<numeric>)

Summarize Numeric Variables

t_summary(<factor>)

Summarize Categorical Data

t_summary(<logical>)

Summarize Boolean Data

t_summary(<character>)

Summarize Character Data

t_summary(<Date>)

Summarize Date Data

t_el_abn_shift()

Count abnormality shift from baseline for each abnormality level

t_el_abnormality()

Abnormality count

t_el_ancova()

Elementary table for analysis of covariance (ANCOVA).

t_el_count_unique()

Count unique elements per cell in a vector

t_el_disposition()

Single element for disposition table

t_el_events_per_term_id()

Summary table for events

t_el_forest_rsp()

Elementary table

t_el_forest_tte()

Elementary table

t_el_multinomial_proportion()

Proportions: outcomes by level

t_el_odds_ratio()

OR: elementary summary table

t_el_proportion()

Proportion: outcomes

t_el_proportion_diff()

Table for difference in proportions

t_el_test_proportion_diff()

Table for testing difference in proportions

t_coxph_pairwise()

Proportional Hazards Regression Model Fit Summary Table (pair-wise for multiple arms)

t_km()

Kaplan-Meier Fit Summary Table

t_max_grade_per_id()

Tabulate maximum grade per id by col_by

t_count_unique()

Count unique elements per cell in a vector with subgroups

t_count_true(<default>)

Return an rtable with a no Method Message

t_count_true(<logical>)

Tabulate TRUE counts in a vector

t_summarize_by_visit()

Summary Table by Visit

t_contingency()

Contingency table (stacked per group)

Analysis and Summary Functions

These functions return statistical results from different models

ttest_ci_one_arm()

Function: CI

ttest_two_arm()

Function: t-test

s_coxph_pairwise()

Pairwise model

s_cox_univariate()

Cox regression including a single covariate - summarized results

s_cox_multivariate()

Multivariate Cox Model - summarized results

s_logistic_single()

Summary

s_logistic_interaction()

Summary

s_proportion()

Outcomes summary

s_proportion_diff()

Summary of difference between two proportions

s_adj_proportion_diff()

Proportions: weights

s_test_proportion_diff()

Test for difference between two proportions

s_ancova()

Summary for analysis of covariance (ANCOVA).

s_odds_ratio()

OR: summary

s_mmrm()

Summary

Graphs

Graphs

g_forest()

Create a Forest Plot based on a Table

g_km()

Kaplan-Meier Plot

g_waterfall()

Horizontal Waterfall Plot

g_mmrm_diagnostic()

Diagnostic plots for an MMRM model.

g_mmrm_lsmeans()

Plot the LS means of an MMRM model.

Analysis Helper Functions

these functions are useful to help definining the analysis

arm()

Identity function to indicate specials in formulas

get_N()

Get total count

col_N_add_total()

Add total to col_N

tabulate_pairwise()

Statistics

footnotes()

Retrieve value from attribute footnote of object x

`footnotes<-`()

Attribute

`add_footnotes<-`()

Add more footnotes

control_coxph()

Control

control_binary_comparison()

Control function for binary comparison analyses

Graphs Helper Functions

these functions are useful to modify graphs

decorate_grob()

Add Titles, Footnotes, Page Number, and a Bounding Box to a Grid Grob

decorate_grob_factory()

Page number

decorate_grob_set()

Decorate all a set of grobs and add the page numbering

split_text_grob()

Split Text According To Available Text Width

stack_grobs()

Stack multiple grobs

arrange_grobs()

Arrange multiple grobs

draw_grob()

Draw grob

color_palette()

Color palettes used in NEST

stat_mean_ci()

Mean CI for ggplot2

stat_median_ci()

Median CI for ggplot2

Data Helper Functions

these functions are used by other functions to derive data

explicit_na()

Missing data

sas_na()

Convert empty strings and strings with only whitespaces to NA

safe_join()

Safer join for tern

combine_levels()

Factors

drop_shared_variables()

Remove Shared Variables

as_factor_keep_attributes()

Factors

check_id()

Checks

df_explicit_na()

Prepare data to be used in a teal app

get_onco_rsp_label()

Get label for standard oncology response categories

a_mean_sd() a_median() a_n_true_and_freq() a_count() a_q1q3() a_iqr() a_range()

rtabulate-friendly aggregation functions (a_*)

Deprecated Functions

These functions will eventually be removed

na_as_level()

NA replace

r_by()

Recursive by

a_mmrm()

(Deprecated) Fit the MMRM Model

t_mmrm()

(Deprecated) Mix model with repeated measurements (MMRM) model

Trees

The functions are used to for computing compound tables. These functions are under active development and may change frequenly in upcoming releases. Also note that we will probably make table trees an intrinsic part of rtables and hence those functions might be moved to another package in the future.

node()

An S4 Class to represent nodes in a tree

summary(<node>)

Method overwrite

`[[`(<node>)

Allows to access nodes recursively, each element in index can either be a number or the name of the node

object_to_node()

Create a node with only this object

nested_list_to_tree()

Convert to tree

recursive_construct_tree()

Tree construction

rsplit()

Split recursively

non_rsplit()

Split list in the classic way instead of applying split to each element

rsplit_to_tree()

List split

invisible_node()

Creates an invisible node with NULL content and invisible name

invisible_node_name()

Create an invisible node

esplit()

Split objects

esplit(<data.frame>)

Split data.frame

esplit(<default>)

Default method for atomic

esplit(<list>)

Split list element

esplit(<non_rsplit>)

Class: recursion

basic_node_info()

Object summary

displayable()

Output: display

rapply_tree()

Apply function: tree node

full_apply_at_depth()

Applies f to node at given depth in depth-first order

rsort_tree()

Return children

node_format_data()

Format

to_rtable()

Object: convert

rreplace_format()

Replace format of rtables cells

Non-exported Functions

the documentation for those unexported functions is useful for developers

argument_convention

Dummy Function that Documents all Standard Arguments

apply_compare_in_header()

Stacks x and col_by when compare_in_header attribute is present

check_col_by()

Checks that x, col_by and col_N are consistent in dimensions

check_conf_level()

Check if Argument Describes Confidence Levels for Different Confidence Intervals and Tests

combine_rrows_with_indent()

Combine lists

compare_in_header()

Compare the list items / data.frame columns in the header

is_nested_by()

Check whether is of class nested_by

is_simple_by()

Class check

nb_entries()

Returns the number of entries in x

nested_by()

Recursive by

patient_numeric_fcns()

Functions

simple_by()

Non-recursive by object

t_summary(<list>)

Helper function for t_summary_by

to_string_with_names()

String

t_count_true(<list>)

Tabulate TRUE counts in a list

check_mmrm_vars()

MMRM

build_mmrm_formula()

Helper function to build the MMRM formula

fit_lme4_single_optimizer()

Fitting

summary_all_fits()

Helper function to extract summaries from a list of lme4 fit objects.

refit_lme4_all_optimizers()

Re-Fitting

fit_lme4()

Fitting

get_mmrm_lsmeans()

Extract LS means

get_lme4_cov_estimate()

Covariance

cbind(<rtable>)

Helper

as.rtable(<data.frame>)

Helper

get_lme4_diagnostics()

Linear mixed model
